revised_title: Exploring the Structure of Collagen Subfibrils with D-Periodicity
tldr: The authors present evidence of a five-stranded microfibril in collagen with a diameter of 3.7-4.0 nm and a D-period of 66.8 nm. This structure is found in reprecipitated cartilage collagen and is likely the five-stranded microfibril suggested by Smith (1968). The findings contribute to our understanding of the arrangement of collagen molecules within filaments.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Molecular Biology
